other_tests.findings: The initial AIMS score was 2.4, indicating low levels of tardive dyskinesia. After treatment with reserpine, the AIMS score showed marked improvement, dropping to 1.0 at week 4.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The AIMS scores fluctuated over time with scores of 2.2 at week 13 and returning to higher levels of 3.2 by week 39, indicating a worsening of tardive dyskinesia after discontinuation of reserpine.
